meanings.definition: Cause (a large amount of damage or harm)
meanings.sent1: The storm did wreak havoc on the small town.
meanings.sent2: The earthquake can wreak destruction on buildings.
meanings.sent3: Don't let the mischievous puppy wreak chaos in the house!
meanings.sent4: His anger could wreak a storm of emotions within him.
meanings.sent5: The wildfire can wreak devastation on the forest.

meanings.sent1: The superhero vowed to wreak justice on the villain.
meanings.sent2: The judge can wreak punishment on the guilty criminal.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous leprechaun decided to wreak playful tricks on the villagers.
meanings.sent4: Her words could wreak vengeance on those who wronged her.
meanings.sent5: The wizard threatened to wreak a curse on the kingdom.

meanings.definition: Bring about (a particular result or effect)
meanings.sent1: His actions could wreak positive changes in the community.
meanings.sent2: The new policy may wreak improvements in the company.
meanings.sent3: The magic potion could wreak unexpected transformations on the potion maker.
meanings.sent4: Her smile could wreak happiness in the hearts of others.
meanings.sent5: The scientist's experiment might wreak groundbreaking discoveries.
